name: Bucklands Beach to Panmure Basin
description:
Mostly flat and mostly coastal, this run is ideal for clocking up the miles ready for that upcoming marathon, half or ultra. The course is a simple lollipop that follows the Rotary Walkway south to the Panmure Basin where we complete an anti-clockwise loop, before heading home.
To shorten, turn back at any time. To lengthen, there are plenty of options around Musick Point and Bucklands Beach.

name: Mangere Bridge Watercare Walkway
description:
Flat and mostly off road—this is the place to get in LOTS of miles to get you ready for that upcoming half or full marathon!
Meeting at the Mangere Boating Club we’ll head south from there along the coast through Ambury Regional Park, around the lake in the south (turn back here for 13k) and then carry on south along the Watercare Pathway.
Once back to the boat club we’ll have options to carry on north to the Onehunga coastal path.So there is plenty of extra mileage to be done here on flat trails.

name: Mission Bay Two Lookouts
description:
From Mission Bay we’ll make the short journey west before along Tamaki Drive before climbing up to the trig at Bastion Point. We’ll retrace our steps back to Mission Bay before heading out to the lookout at Achilles Point. Retracing our steps one more time back to the beach and cafes of Mission Bay to finish a nice cruisy return to our Sunday runs.
We will also have an optional extra 3k excursion into the trails of Dingle Dell Reserve (at St Heliers) on the way back to Mission Bay.

meetingPoint.label: The car park opposite Mission Bay’s Berkeley Cinemas

label.title: Glover park loop
label.description: Adds an additional 2k onto the run

name: Mission Bay to Tahuna Torea
description:
This run takes you beyond the confines of Tamaki drive and into some of the hidden gems of Auckland's eastern bays.
The route heads east to Achilles Point, then to Glover Park, Churchill Park, Glendowie Park and eventually to the stunning Tahuna Torea Nature Reserve.
It's a 17k out-and-back, but there are plenty of options to make it shorter (including turning back at Achilles Point - 7k or Glover Park - 10k).  Longer options include an add-on afterwards along Tamaki Drive.

meetingPoint.label: The car park opposite Mission Bay’s Berkeley Cinemas

name: Maraetai Omana Regional Park
description: This is a stunning seaside run with a great cafe and beach to relax at once all the running has been done. Oh which there is plenty of running out here! We’ll head west first heading along the coast to the marina at Beachlands, before retracing our steps back to Maraetai (18k in total). For those going longer there is a great 14k out-and-back to Duder Regional Park heading east along the coast road.

afterRunInformation.content: After the run, we usually meet at the Maraetai Wharf Cafe (opposite the starting point), the usual suspects (coffee, breakfast and cabinet options) are all available plus there is indoor or outdoor seating (depending on the weather!). The fastest runners will arrive around 9:30 a.m.

carrotCake.review: Mike likes data entry a lot

label.title: Duder regional park extension
label.description: Take this out and back route either before or after the group run to add a total of 14k (7k each way)

annotations.title: Omana Regional Park
annotations.description: Follow main driveway then main trail

name: Okura Bush Walkway
description:
This is possibly the most beautiful bush track in Auckland and it is a must-do Auckland run, and just 20mins north of central Auckland.
The trail is soft under foot with a few hills and lots of coastal views, lush bush and blue water.
If the weather is nasty, the bush provides plenty of shelter and is mostly well drained so will be a great weather option.
The run itself is 7k oneway, so a 14k return journey. To run shorter, just turn around at any spot (Dacre Cottage at 4k is a great option). To run longer you can carry on into Stillwater or add on extra at the end.

name: Titirangi - Waiatarua Circuit
description:
This is the legendary course that Arthur Lydiard trained all his world-beating runners on back in the 60s.
We'll be doing a 21.5k loop from Titirangi up West Coast Road and down Scenic Drive and Exhibition Drive. There are options to go shorter by cutting through Shaw Rd - 14.5k, or longer by adding on an out and back along Exhibition Drive - 28k.
This a classic Auckland run, that is known by runners all over the world. Don't miss it!
Much of this run is on winding, country roads.  Please wear something bright so cars can see you.
NOTE: Traffic on this route is busy. All runners joining us run at their own risk and agree not to hold the club or any run leaders responsible for any injury or damages to person or belongings.
importantNotes: Some of this run is on-road with no footpath. We strongly recommend bright or reflective clothing and request that you do not wear headphones for this run.

meetingPoint.label: Titirangi car park, cnr Titirangi Rd. & South Titirangi Rd.

label.title: Shaw Road
label.description: Cutting through Shaw road shortens the route to 14k.5

annotations.title: Longer run option
annotations.description: Turn around here, and do an out and back along Exhibition Drive. This adds 7k to the run.

name: Auckland Domain Three Peaks
description:
Conquer Auckland’s three central volcanic peaks of Mt Hobson, Mt St John and Mt Eden, before making your through the lush trails of Auckland Domain.
Plenty of options to shorten the route or climb fewer Peaks. If three climbs aren't enough to earn your breakfast, then add-on drops down through Ayr Reserve for a stiff climb climb back up through Newmarket Park.

label.title: Ayr Reserve extension
label.description: This loop of Ayr Reserve and Newmarket Park adds on 3k

name: Onepoto Tuff Crater
description:
Very few Aucklanders know about the network of mind-bogglingly beautiful parks and bush reserves in Northcote and Birkenhead. This is your chance to discover them.
We're going to string these beautiful parks together beginning with an out-and-back from Onepoto Reserve to Smiths Bush (via Tuff Crater) - 12.5k. Then a loop connecting Kauri Glen Bush to Le Roys Bush and back to Onepoto (an additional hilly 7k). So 19k for both loops with options to run shorter (turning back after Tuff Crater - 8k) or longer completing another loop.

meetingPoint.label: Onepoto Domain, off Tarahanga St., via Sylvan Ave.

label.title: Kauri Glen - Le Roys Bush circuit

name: Totara Park
description:
South Auckland’s premier destination for running, Totara Park includes beautiful bush, some meaty hills and meandering mountain bike paths that are soft under foot—ideal for a lap or two on this 10k course.
We’ll start by heading west to do a partial loop around the lower bush section before following the western border of the park up to the mountain bike paths of:

Hub Connector (Fat Man’s Revenge)
Pony Express
Anaconda

Then we do one small loop around the eastern portion of the lower bush to make a total of 10k. Add on by doing another lap... or two!

label.title: DIC mountain bike trail
label.description: Drunk In Charge MTB trail. Adds 1k, technical and windy with switchbacks and can be a bit slippery but a lot of fun to run!

name: Cornwall Park
description:
Auckland's answer to Central Park (just with more sheep poo and fences to jump!).
The loop follows the rolling perimeter trails of the park, with a full lap being 9k and an option to cut the lap short at 5k. Two laps equals 18k.

meetingPoint.label: Cornwall Park Cafe, near band rotunda, end of Twin Oaks drive.

name: Takapuna Greenway
description:
Starting at Takapuna Beach Cafe (22 The Promenade) we'll head down the coast first along the beach and then jump over to the Greenway and follow it south along the western side of the peninsula to reach Devonport. From here we'll follow the Auckland Marathon course back north to Takapuna.
This full run 15km but if you'd like to make it 11k, head left via Seabreeze Rd to Narrow Neck Beach (you'll still experience the main two hills of the Takapuna section of the Auckland Marathon course).
To make it 8k, head left along Bayswater Ave to Lake Road.

name: Hobson Bay, Orakei Basin loop
description:
Probably the most run stretch of pavement in New Zealand, we'll start with a gentle jog along Tamaki Drive to Ngapipi Rd. (option to turn back here, for 6k total). Then sign a left to run around Hobson Bay, and Orakei Basin, up Brighton Road, down St Stephens (past what used to be John Key's place) and then back along Tamaki Drive.
The full loop is 16.5k, but can be shortened to 14.5k by skipping Orakei Basin. If you'd like to add on more, a 6k out-and-back to St Heliers is ideal.

meetingPoint.label: The car park opposite Mission Bay’s Berkeley Cinemas

label.title: Orakei Basin shortcut
label.description: Keep going along Orakei Rd. instead of around Orakei Basin.  Saves 2k.

label.title: Add-on
label.description: An option to for those wanting to go longer is an out and back to St. Heliers.  Adds 6k
